regulation.title: Title IX Sex Discrimination and Sex-Based Harassment Complaint Procedures

issues.title: Missing Board Policy for Title IX Sex Discrimination and Sex-Based Harassment
issues.description: The district has only an Administrative Regulation (AR 4219.12) but no corresponding Board Policy (BP 4219.12). California law requires school districts to adopt board policies establishing the district's commitment to nondiscrimination and the framework for Title IX compliance. The regulation contains detailed procedures but lacks the foundational policy statements, board direction, and rights notifications that should be contained in a board policy.

legal_citations.text: It is the policy of the State of California to afford all persons in public schools, regardless of their disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, nationality, race or ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic that is contained in the definition of hate crimes set forth in Section 422.55 of the Penal Code, equal rights and opportunities in the educational institutions of the state.

issues.required_language: The Board Policy should include: (1) A clear statement of the district's commitment to providing an educational environment free from sex discrimination and sex-based harassment; (2) A statement that sex discrimination and sex-based harassment are prohibited and will not be tolerated; (3) A statement that retaliation against any person who reports, files a complaint, or participates in the complaint process is prohibited; (4) Identification of the Title IX Coordinator and how to contact them; (5) A statement that the district will take prompt and effective steps to eliminate sex discrimination and harassment, prevent its recurrence, and remedy its effects; (6) Reference to the complaint procedures contained in the administrative regulation.

issues.title: Missing Title IX Coordinator Contact Information
issues.description: While the regulation references that contact information for the Title IX Coordinator is listed in AR 4119.11/4219.11/4319.11, this information should also be readily available in the Title IX policy/regulation itself. Federal regulations require that districts prominently display Title IX Coordinator contact information.

legal_citations.text: Each recipient must designate and authorize at least one employee to coordinate its efforts to comply with its responsibilities under this part, which employee must be referred to as the "Title IX Coordinator." The recipient must notify applicants for admission and employment, students, parents or legal guardians of elementary and secondary school students, employees, and all unions or professional organizations holding collective bargaining or professional agreements with the recipient, of the name or title, office address, electronic mail address, and telephone number of the employee or employees designated as the Title IX Coordinator.

issues.required_language: The policy or regulation must include the Title IX Coordinator's name or title, office address, email address, and telephone number, or state where this information can be found and ensure it is readily accessible.

issues.title: Missing Non-Retaliation Statement
issues.description: While the regulation mentions prohibition against false statements, it lacks a clear, prominent statement prohibiting retaliation against individuals who report sex discrimination or harassment, file complaints, or participate in the complaint process. This is a fundamental protection required by Title IX.

legal_citations.text: No recipient or other person may intimidate, threaten, coerce, or discriminate against any individual for the purpose of interfering with any right or privilege secured by title IX or this part, or because the individual has made a report or complaint, testified, assisted, or participated or refused to participate in any manner in an investigation, proceeding, or hearing under this part.

issues.required_language: The district prohibits retaliation against any person who reports sex discrimination or harassment, files a complaint, or participates in the complaint process. Retaliation is a violation of federal law and district policy and will result in disciplinary action.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Pregnancy-Related Discrimination
issues.description: The regulation focuses on sexual harassment but does not explicitly address other forms of sex discrimination covered by Title IX, such as pregnancy-related discrimination, which should be included for comprehensive coverage.

legal_citations.text: A recipient shall not discriminate against any student, or exclude any student from its education program or activity, including any class or extracurricular activity, on the basis of such student's pregnancy, childbirth, false pregnancy, termination of pregnancy, or recovery therefrom.

issues.required_language: The district prohibits discrimination based on sex, including discrimination based on pregnancy, childbirth, false pregnancy, termination of pregnancy, or recovery therefrom.
